title: Trust protocols for the agentic web

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Thu, 18 Sept 25\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Trust Theory and Foundations\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Trust reduces social complexity and enables coordination at scale\
• Types of trust frameworks:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Confidence vs trust (conscious leap of faith under risk)\
◦ Interpersonal vs system trust\
◦ Particularized vs generalized trust\
◦ Value-based vs proof-based trust\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Technology acts as mediator of human relations\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Amplifies and reduces perception/experience\
◦ Creates affordances that shape behavior and reality\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Trust Protocol Categories and Examples\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Four-quadrant framework for trust protocols:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Value-based + Social: handshakes, hospital symbols, cultural norms\
◦ Value-based + Technical: user agreements, institutional documents\
◦ Proof-based + Social: Uber ratings, Airbnb reviews, crowd consensus\
◦ Proof-based + Technical: blockchains, smart contracts, cryptographic proofs\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Historical evolution: kinship → religion → platforms → cryptography\
• Scaling from individual to planetary coordination requires increasingly technical protocols\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Rise of the Agentic Web\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Emerging internet layer where autonomous AI agents operate independently\
• Billions of AI agents anticipated within years across sectors:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Governance: policy drafting, disaster response\
◦ Finance: autonomous trading, tax filing\
◦ Healthcare: elder care, remote monitoring, therapy\
◦ Legal: contract writing, dispute mediation\
◦ Education: AI tutoring, personalized learning\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Shift from attention is all you need to trust is all you need\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Decentralized AI Agents (D-Agents)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• New paradigm combining autonomy with self-sovereignty\
• Technical enablers:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ TEE (Trusted Execution Environments) for compute management\
◦ Noncustodial wallets for financial resources\
◦ Social media presence for narrative building and influence\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Truth Terminal case study:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ First AI millionaire through meme coin promotion\
◦ Convinced Marc Andreessen for $50K funding\
◦ 200K Twitter followers, autonomous content creation\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Spawn.fun experiment: AI-only reproduction with evolutionary rules\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Current Protocol Gaps and Challenges\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Existing protocols focus on discovery/identity but lack:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Continuous behavior verification\
◦ Misbehavior handling mechanisms\
◦ Clear definition of trustworthy behavior\
◦ Human-in-the-loop governance\
◦ Legal and social accountability frameworks\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Design challenges:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ AI-AI coordination without human oversight\
◦ Cross-platform interoperability\
◦ Verification in black-box systems\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Trust Experience Design Framework\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Three-layer approach for human-AI trust:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Evidence: cryptographic attestations, audit trails, proofs\
◦ Trust primitives: identification systems, verifiable credentials, technical building blocks\
◦ Rituals/Experience: confirmations, ceremonies, ambient feedback, social endorsement\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Four dimensions of trust experience:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Epistemic verification (self-directed research capability)\
◦ Social coproduction (networks, community validation)\
◦ Temporal reliability (historical performance, precedent)\
◦ Collective legitimation (mass social proof, market validation)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Hardness concept: system trusted when cost to corrupt exceeds willingness to pay
